20 seconds away
20 seconds away
Approaching
Approaching
Explosions in Starokostyantyniv
All clear. 4 Kinzhal impacts to Starokostyantyniv Airbase.

4-6 MiG-31K fighters have been equipped with Kinzhal hypersonic aeroballistic missiles at Savasleika Airbase and have been carrying out active training missions over the past week, including with simulated launches.
Well, there go the 4 MiG-31Ks I reported on before.
Approximate flight paths of the MiG-31K fighters and Kinzhal missiles.

Wake up... First thing I see is AMK Mapping rationing ISW regarding that war is not linear.
Today's going to be a good day
Wake up... First thing I see is AMK Mapping rationing ISW regarding that war is not linear.  Today's going to be a good day

Professional think tank vs teenage BROSINTter. 
Who wins?
1 "Varshavyanka" submarine has been deployed from Novorossiysk Naval Base to the Black Sea.

It would make sense if there were a missile attack on Ukraine tonight, excluding strategic bombers. 
3-4 Tu-22m3 bombers are airborne right now, redeploying back to Belaya Airbase, Irkutsk Oblast.
Keep in mind, my probability reports are primarily based on strategic aviation movement, which is why there can be attacks excluding Kh-101 missiles even when I say they are unlikely.
I will continue to monitor.

There is activity on Russian strategic frequencies, but it is likely related to training/redeployment in western Russia. 
We will see.
These movements are really weird. It isn't adding up right now.

It seems that the 4 Tu-95MS from Ukrainka Airbase were already equipped with Kh-101 cruise missiles prior to arriving at Diaghilev Airbase this evening. 
There are reports of aircraft in the air, but I cannot confirm this right now. It's possible that the Tu-95MS redeployed to Engels-2 airbase instead of Diaghilev.
Meanwhile, mass launches of Geran-2 drones have begun.
As for the frequency activity, they are indeed related to combat operations, but its unclear which airbase command and control in Moscow is communicating with.

Launches of Geran-2 have been reported from the following launch sites:
Tsumbulova Test Site, Oryol Oblast (x2)
Hvariiske Training Ground, Crimea (x2)
Navlya Test Site, Bryansk Oblast (x2)
Khalino Airbase, Kursk Oblast (x2)
Millerovo Airbase, Rostov Oblast (x2)
Primorsko-Akhtarsk Airbase, Krasnodar Krai (x1)
Multiple Russian KAB glide-bombs struck the eastern suburbs of Kharkiv and the city of Derhachi. Power outages are reported.
Multiple Russian KAB glide-bombs struck the eastern suburbs of Kharkiv and the city of Derhachi. Power outages are reported.

More conflicting reports on Russian strategic bomber movements and activity.
Things will become clearer later on. Any launches of Kh-101 cruise missiles wont take place for at least 7 more hours.

In my opinion, the most likely thing that happened was that 2 of the 4 Tu-95MS were already equipped with Kh-101 cruise missiles.
These two landed at Engels-2 Airbase.
The other two landed at Diaghilev Airbase, Ryazan Oblast. 
The 2 Tu-95MS from Diaghilev redeployed to Engels-2 Airbase to be equipped with missiles, while the two from Engels-2, redeployed to Diaghilev.
This is only a possibility right now. As I said, these movements are very unusual.
All other signs suggest that a large attack will take place tonight, but nothing is confirmed at this moment.

Israeli Forces Came Under Attack In Syria, At Least 13 Killed In Clashes And Strikes (videos) 
Israeli troops came under attack while operating in southern Syria early on November 28, with reports indicating that over a dozen people, including women and children, were killed in retaliatory strikes.
In a statement, the Israeli Defense Forces (IDF) said that troops of the 55th Reserve Paratroopers Brigade set out in the early morning to detain members of the al-Jama‚Äôa al-Islamiyya (Islamic Group), following intelligence information collected in recent weeks indicating that they were operating in the Syrian town of Beit Jinn and worked to advance attacks on Israel.
"During the operation, terrorists opened fire at IDF troops, who returned fire," the military said, adding that the Israeli Air Force also struck the area to support the ground troops.
The IDF admitted two officers and a reservist were seriously hurt as a result of the fire. 
Read more 
HERE

Israel Attacks Lebanon On Anniversary Of Ceasefire, Boast About Killing Over 300 Within Year (Videos)
A wave of Israeli strikes hit southern Lebanon on November 27, the first anniversary of the ceasefire brokered by the United States.
The strikes targeted the towns of Jarmaq and Mahmoudiyeh, along with other areas in southern Lebanon. The IDF later said in a statement that the strikes hit Hezbollah targets, including rocket-launching sites, weapon depots, and military posts belonging to the group.
Following the latest wave of strikes, the IDF announced that it had killed over 370 ‚Äúterror operatives‚Äù in Lebanon since the ceasefire came into effect on November 27 of last year.
Read more 
HERE

Iran Deployed Its Aging F-14s During War With Israel, Shot Down Multiple Drones (Video)
The Islamic Republic of Iran Air Force (IRIAF) deployed its aging American-made F-14 interceptor jets during the 12-day war with Israel last June, a documentary aired by the Islamic Republic‚Äôs state TV on November 10 revealed.
Iran received at least 79 F-14A/AM from the United States in the 1970s. By the time Israel launched its attack on the Islamic Republic‚Äôs nuclear program on June 13, only 40-20 of the jets were still in service.
The documentary ‚ÄúUnequal Battle,‚Äù which was produced by the media division for the Islamic Republic of Iran Army ‚ÄúArtesh,‚Äù revealed that these jets, despite major difficulties, took to the sky with the start of the war with the main task of intercepting Israeli drones.
Read more 
HERE

Ukrainian Defenses Are Cracking In Siversk And Krasny Liman (Videos)
On November 28, the Russian military developed its operations in Siversk and Krasny Liman in Donetsk as Ukrainian defenses around both key cities began to crack.
In Siversk, the Yug [South] Group of Forces is reported to be in control of most of the city‚Äôs eastern part. Fierce clashes are reported taking part in the center of the city, mainly, along the railway.
To the south of the city, Russian troops have launched a new offensive from Zvanivka, which was captured just a few days earlier, towards Sviato-Pokrovske. A large area to the east of the settlement has been captured. The troops will likely storm the settlement from this direction very soon.
Read more 
HERE

Operation Silence: Why Berlin Is Killing the Truth About War and Peace
Something is happening in Germany that rips up everything Western Europe claims to stand for. On live national TV, Welt‚Äôs anchor killed the microphone of Sahra Wagenknecht‚Äîthe only heavyweight opposition figure left who dares question Berlin‚Äôs rush toward conflict. Her crime? Not lying, not slandering, but speaking an inconvenient truth: that the Ukraine war could have ended years ago if real diplomacy had prevailed. Call it what it is‚Äîthis wasn‚Äôt a ‚Äútechnical glitch.‚Äù It‚Äôs a diagnosis: Germany, once the role model of open society, is now marching under the banner of military censorship, muzzling dissent to prep for its next eastern war.
Wagenknecht, leader of the BSW party and the last system rebel in the Bundestag, was discussing the root causes of the Ukrainian tragedy. She uttered the modern German taboo: ‚ÄúIstanbul 2022.‚Äù In plain language, she told viewers that Kyiv could have kept its land...
